metadata.title: CVE-2019-16232 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
drivers/net/wireless/marvell/libertas/if_sdio.c in the Linux kernel 5.2.14does not check the alloc_workqueue return value, leading to a NULL pointerdereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16232` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-207.239
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-207.239
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-88-generic - 4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-88-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-88-lowlatency - 4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-88-generic - 4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-88-lowlatency - 4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1091-kvm - 4.4.0-1091.100
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1126-aws - 4.4.0-1126.140
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1060-aws - 4.15.0-1060.62~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-azure - 4.15.0-1071.76
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1055-gcp - 4.15.0-1055.59
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1033-oracle - 4.15.0-1033.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1150-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1150.161
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1154-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1154.164
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-207.239').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-88.88~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1091.100').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.140').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1060.62~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.76').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.59').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1033.36~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1150.161').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1154.164').
